main event: On June 2, 1949, at 0010 MST, in Los Alamos, New Mexico, a green-colored 'ball of light' was observed descending from east to north with a long unbroken green trail of the same width as the object.
interesting points: The observation lasted only one second.
The object was estimated to be at an altitude of 7,000 to 10,000 feet and at a distance of approximately 5 miles.
It had a self-luminous quality and no sound or odor was reported.
The observers saw no projections on the object and noted no effect on the clouds.
The observer, a security inspector, worked for AESS (Atomic Energy Commission Special Services) and was found to meet the requirements for employment with AESS.
sighted object: green 'ball of light' with a long unbroken green trail
